name: unsatisfactorily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not good enough: Prices for corn and soybeans have remained unsatisfactorily low for many farmers. At the end of the novel, we are unsatisfactorily left to draw our own conclusions.
More examplesFewer examplesAfter becoming bogged down in disagreements, the talks ended unsatisfactorily.Having briefly and unsatisfactorily studied philosophy at university, she spent several years teaching in South America. Somewhat unsatisfactorily, though typically for an event of this type, the two winners never actually played each other.
